medical_history.chief_complaint: Ventricular preexcitation and recurrent syncopal events.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 2 with syncopal events, atrial fibrillation, and ECG evidence of ventricular preexcitation. By age 10, the patient underwent six electrical cardioversions. At age 13, episodes of atrial fibrillation led to ventricular escape rhythms and syncope. The patient has been in chronic atrial fibrillation since age 15 and is currently dependent on ventricular pacing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Persistent hypertension since age 33; no cardiac hypertrophy detected despite being in the fifth decade of life.
medical_history.family_history: Father diagnosed with Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome, died suddenly at age 31. Younger brother presented with seizures attributed to tachycardia associated with Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome, required pacemaker implantation at age 22.
